snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday’s selections include a social network for police officers that is being tested in the Los Angeles area, and a former federal...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday’s selections include a social network for police officers that is being tested in the Los Angeles area, and a former federal prosecutor calling for reworking the old standards of privacy and surveillance because of modern technology.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Facebook for Police, and Changing the Rules for Surveillance
